cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northeast, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend Thursday night, then accelerate northeastward along / just inland of the U.S. East Coast before curving back over the western Atlantic near the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Suwannee River – Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Suwannee River FL and Mexico Beach to Destin FL; Tropical Storm Watch Marineland FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Suwannee River to Mexico Beach FL; Tropical Storm Warning Anclote River to Suwannee River FL and Mexico Beach to Destin FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida to New England, including New Jersey and New York Bight
weather_observation.wind: Gale-force winds (35-45 mph, occasional higher gusts) possible Sunday night into Monday as the center passes just south/east of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft above ground possible in the New York Bight at times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Sunday through early Monday; totals generally 1–2 inches with localized 3 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas in the approaches, dangerous rip currents, and possible port‐side coastal flooding of low-lying terminals.
